verbs.description: decompensate (third-person singular simple present decompensates, present participle decompensating, simple past and past participle decompensated)

entries.meaning: (medicine, psychology, of a bodily organ or mental state) To deteriorate in function due to an inability to invoke normal defensive mechanisms that compensate for ailments and other stresses.
examples: The infant whose heart is decompensating has a rapid pulse, rapid respirations, and respiratory distress.
